identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

additionalConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connectivity type specific further configuration (e.g. OPC UA, Modbus, ONVIF).

authentication.description: Defines the client authentication mechanism to the server.

discoveredAssetEndpointProfileRef.description: Reference to a discovered asset endpoint profile. Populated only if the asset endpoint profile has been created from discovery flow. Discovered asset endpoint profile name must be provided.

endpointProfileType.description: Defines the configuration for the connector type that is being used with the endpoint profile.

targetAddress.description: The local valid URI specifying the network address/DNS name of a southbound device. The scheme part of the targetAddress URI specifies the type of the device. The additionalConfiguration field holds further connector type specific configuration.

assetEndpointProfileRef.description: A reference to the asset endpoint profile (connection information) used by brokers to connect to an endpoint that provides data points for this asset. Must provide asset endpoint profile name.

attributes.description: A set of key-value pairs that contain custom attributes set by the customer.

datasets.description: Array of datasets that are part of the asset. Each dataset describes the data points that make up the set.

defaultDatasetsConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all datasets. Each dataset can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

defaultEventsConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all events. Each event can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

defaultTopic.description: Object that describes the default topic information for the asset.

discoveredAssetRefs.description: Reference to a list of discovered assets. Populated only if the asset has been created from discovery flow. Discovered asset names must be provided.

events.description: Array of events that are part of the asset. Each event can have per-event configuration.

externalAssetId.description: Asset id provided by the customer.

method.description: Defines the method to authenticate the user of the client at the server.

usernamePasswordCredentials.description: Defines the username and password references when UsernamePassword user authentication mode is selected.

x509Credentials.description: Defines the certificate reference when Certificate user authentication mode is selected.

key.description: The MQTT broker state store destination key.

certificateAuthorityConfiguration.description: The configuration to set up an ICA.

dataPointConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the data point. For OPC UA, this could include configuration like, publishingInterval, samplingInterval, and queueSize.

dataSource.description: The address of the source of the data in the asset (e.g. URL) so that a client can access the data source on the asset.

name.description: The name of the data point.

observabilityMode.description: An indication of how the data point should be mapped to OpenTelemetry.

dataPoints.description: Array of data points that are part of the dataset. Each data point can have per-data point configuration.

datasetConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific JSON string that describes configuration for the specific dataset.

topic.description: Object that describes the topic information for the specific dataset.

configuration.description: The MQTT broker state store destination configuration.

address.description: The endpoint address to connect to.

endpointType.description: Type of connection used for the messaging endpoint.

endpointName.description: The name of endpoint to use

additionalConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains configuration to be used by the connector (e.g., OPC UA, ONVIF).

address.description: The endpoint address & port. This can be either an IP address (e.g., 192.168.1.1) or a fully qualified domain name (FQDN, e.g., server.example.com).

lastUpdatedOn.description: The timestamp (in UTC) when the endpoint was discovered.

supportedAuthenticationMethods.description: List of supported authentication methods supported by device for Inbound connections.

version.description: Protocol version associated with the endpoint e.g. 1 or 2 for endpointType Microsoft.HTTP, and 3.5 or 5.0 for endpointType Microsoft.Mqtt etc.

inbound.description: Set of endpoints to connect to the device.

outbound.description: Set of endpoints a device can connect to.

assigned.description: Endpoints the device can connect to.

eventConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the event. For OPC UA, this could include configuration like, publishingInterval, samplingInterval, and queueSize.

eventNotifier.description: The address of the notifier of the event in the asset (e.g. URL) so that a client can access the event on the asset.

observabilityMode.description: An indication of how the event should be mapped to OpenTelemetry.

topic.description: Object that describes the topic information for the specific event.

method.description: Defines the method to authenticate the user of the client at the server.

usernamePasswordCredentials.description: Defines the username and password references when UsernamePassword user authentication mode is selected.

x509Credentials.description: Defines the certificate reference when Certificate user authentication mode is selected.

additionalConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains configuration to be used by the connector (e.g., OPC UA, ONVIF).

address.description: The endpoint address & port. This can be either an IP address (e.g., 192.168.1.1) or a fully qualified domain name (FQDN, e.g., server.example.com).

authentication.description: Defines the client authentication mechanism to the server.

trustSettings.description: Defines server trust settings for the endpoint.

version.description: Protocol version associated with the endpoint e.g. 1 or 2 for endpointType Microsoft.HTTP, and 3.5 or 5.0 for endpointType Microsoft.Mqtt etc.

actionConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the action.

targetUri.description: The target URI on which a client can invoke the specific action.

topic.description: The MQTT topic path on which a client will receive the request for the action.

actions.description: Array of actions that are part of the management group. Each action can have an individual configuration.

dataSource.description: Reference to a data source for a given management group.

defaultTimeoutInSeconds.description: Default response timeout for all actions that are part of the management group.

defaultTopic.description: Default MQTT topic path on which a client will receive the request for all actions that are part of the management group.

managementGroupConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the management group.

address.description: The endpoint address to connect to.

endpointType.description: Type of connection used for messaging endpoint.

resourceId.description: The messaging endpoint Azure resource Id.

qos.description: The MQTT QoS setting. Defaults to QoS 1.

retain.description: When set to 'Keep', messages published to an MQTT broker will have the retain flag set. Default: 'Never'.

attributes.description: A set of key-value pairs that contain custom attributes set by the customer.

datasets.description: Array of datasets that are part of the asset. Each dataset describes the data points that make up the set.

defaultDatasetsConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all datasets. Each dataset can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

defaultEventsConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all events. Each event can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

defaultManagementGroupsConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all management groups. Each management group can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

defaultStreamsConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all streams. Each stream can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

deviceRef.description: Reference to the device that provides data for this asset. Must provide device name & endpoint on the device to use.

discoveredAssetRefs.description: Reference to a list of discovered assets. Populated only if the asset has been created from discovery flow. Discovered asset names must be provided.

eventGroups.description: Array of event groups that are part of the asset. Each event group can have per-event group configuration.

externalAssetId.description: Asset ID provided by the customer.

managementGroups.description: Array of management groups that are part of the asset. Each management group can have a per-group configuration.

streams.description: Array of streams that are part of the asset. Each stream can have a per-stream configuration.

dataPoints.description: Array of data points that are part of the dataset. Each data point can have per-data point configuration.

datasetConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific JSON string that describes configuration for the specific dataset.

dataSource.description: Reference to a data source for a given dataset.

dataPointConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the data point. For OPC UA, this could include configuration like, publishingInterval, samplingInterval, and queueSize.

dataSource.description: The address of the source of the data in the asset (e.g. URL) so that a client can access the data source on the asset.

name.description: The name of the data point.

attributes.description: A set of key-value pairs that contain custom attributes set by the customer.

discoveredDeviceRef.description: Reference to a device. Populated only if the device had been created from discovery flow. Discovered device name must be provided.

enabled.description: Indicates if the resource is enabled or not.

endpoints.description: Property bag containing the device's unassigned and assigned endpoints.

externalDeviceId.description: The Device ID provided by the customer.

policy.description: Policy used to issue device certificates.

attributes.description: A set of key-value pairs that contain custom attributes.

datasets.description: Array of datasets that are part of the asset. Each dataset spec describes the data points that make up the set.

defaultDatasetsConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all datasets. Each dataset can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

defaultEventsConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all events. Each event can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

defaultManagementGroupsConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all management groups. Each management group can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

defaultStreamsConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all streams. Each stream can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

deviceRef.description: Reference to the device that provides data for this asset. Must provide device name & endpoint on the device to use.

discoveryId.description: Identifier used to detect changes in the asset.

eventGroups.description: Array of event groups that are part of the asset. Each event group can have per-event group configuration.

externalAssetId.description: Asset ID provided by the customer.

managementGroups.description: Array of management groups that are part of the asset. Each management group can have a per-group configuration.

streams.description: Array of streams that are part of the asset. Each stream can have a per-stream configuration.

version.description: An integer that is incremented each time the resource is modified.

dataPoints.description: Array of data points that are part of the dataset. Each data point can have per-data point configuration.

datasetConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific properties that describes configuration for the specific dataset.

dataSource.description: Reference to a data source for a given dataset.

lastUpdatedOn.description: Timestamp (in UTC) indicating when the dataset was added or modified.

dataPointConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the data point. For OPC UA, this could include configuration like, publishingInterval, samplingInterval, and queueSize.

dataSource.description: The address of the source of the data in the asset (e.g. URL) so that a client can access the data source on the asset.

lastUpdatedOn.description: UTC timestamp indicating when the data point was added or modified.

name.description: The name of the data point.

attributes.description: A set of key-value pairs that contain custom attributes.

discoveryId.description: Identifier used to detect changes in the discovered device.

externalDeviceId.description: A device ID that represents the device in a system external to Azure. Unique within scope of an Azure tenant.

version.description: An integer that is incremented each time the resource is modified.

dataSource.description: Reference to a data source for a given event.

eventConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the event. For OPC UA, this could include configuration like, publishingInterval, samplingInterval, and queueSize.

lastUpdatedOn.description: UTC timestamp indicating when the event was added or modified.

dataSource.description: The address of the notifier of the event group in the asset (e.g. URL) so that a client can access the event group on the asset.

defaultDestinations.description: Destinations for events. Default destinations when destinations is not defined at the event level.

eventGroupConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the event group. For OPC UA, this could include configuration like, publishingInterval, samplingInterval, and queueSize.

events.description: Array of events that are part of the event group.

name.description: The name of the event group.

actionConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the action.

lastUpdatedOn.description: Timestamp (in UTC) indicating when the management action was added or modified.

targetUri.description: The target URI on which a client can invoke the specific action.

topic.description: The MQTT topic path on which a client will receive the request for the action.

actions.description: Array of actions that are part of the management group. Each action can have an individual configuration.

dataSource.description: Reference to a data source for a given management group.

defaultTimeoutInSeconds.description: Default response timeout for all actions that are part of the management group.

defaultTopic.description: Default MQTT topic path on which a client will receive the request for all actions that are part of the management group.

lastUpdatedOn.description: Timestamp (in UTC) indicating when the management group was added or modified.

managementGroupConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the management group.

lastUpdatedOn.description: Timestamp (in UTC) indicating when the stream was added or modified.

streamConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the specific stream.

dataSource.description: Reference to a data source for a given event.

eventConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the event. For OPC UA, this could include configuration like, publishingInterval, samplingInterval, and queueSize.

dataSource.description: The address of the notifier of the event group in the asset (e.g. URL) so that a client can access the event group on the asset.

defaultDestinations.description: Destinations for events. Default destinations when destinations is not defined at the event level.

eventGroupConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the event group. For OPC UA, this could include configuration like, publishingInterval, samplingInterval, and queueSize.

events.description: Array of events that are part of the event group.

name.description: The name of the event group.

streamConfiguration.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the specific stream.

assigned.description: Endpoints the device can connect to.

unassigned.description: Set of most recently removed endpoints.

description.description: Human-readable description of the schema registry.

namespace.description: Schema registry namespace. Uniquely identifies a schema registry within a tenant.

storageAccountContainerUrl.description: The Storage Account's Container URL where schemas will be stored.

type.description: Type of managed service identity (either system assigned, or none).

path.description: The topic path for messages published to an MQTT broker.

retain.description: When set to 'Keep', messages published to an MQTT broker will have the retain flag set. Default: 'Never'.

trustList.description: Defines a secret reference for certificates to trust.

passwordSecretName.description: The name of the secret containing the password.

usernameSecretName.description: The name of the secret containing the username.

certificateSecretName.description: The name of the secret containing the certificate and private key (e.g. stored as .der/.pem or .der/.pfx).

intermediateCertificatesSecretName.description: The name of the secret containing the combined intermediate certificates in PEM format.

keySecretName.description: The name of the secret containing the certificate private key in PEM or DER format.

certificateSecretName.description: The name of the secret containing the certificate and private key (e.g. stored as .der/.pem or .der/.pfx).
